properties.name: 6B Sea Avenue, Katong
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto 6B Sea Avenue, KatongThis was where I lived as a kid until 1970. Have great memories of this place. Would walk down the road to the old Marine Parade beach front that existed before the reclamation work started. Used to play football with my friends along the beach front. Sort of samba beach soccer Katong-style. The area was well-known for its many Chinese Peranakan and Eurasian residents. We were close friends with the Chan family. They used to visit our house at night to watch TV (TV was scarce then) and go home only after the last movie. We used to play with the kids from the Chan family all the time and visit them on Chinese New Year. David Marshall, first Chief Minister of Singapore and a well-known criminal lawyer, used to live nearby.

properties.name: Al-Irsyad Satya Islamic School
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto This is an Islamic school that I helped the Yayasan Parahyangan Satya (YPS) to set up. The school offers both local and international curricula. In the long term, the school should focus on only the international curricula and become a truly international Islamic school. The school currently offers classes at the pre-school, primary school (SD) and secondary school (SMP)levels. It is planned that the school will also be offering high school level (SMA) classes. Students are currently expected to sit for the iPSLE and the IGCSE. The local UASBN is offered only to students in the current upper primary levels. The school also provides for a strong Islamic education. I spent more than a year here acting as trainer, consultant and even as a shadow school Principal. I recruited the teachers and worked with the the teachers in the preparation for the school to open in July 2007. In all, I had only about three months from the recruitment of teachers to the actual opening of the school. The school took off without much of a hitch and has not looked back since. After its opening, I stayed to act as the school\'s full-time consultant guiding the teachers and the management of the school. The school is becoming increasingly popular with parents in Kota Baru Parahyangan and its adjacent areas, and even as far as the city of Bandung itself. It aspires to be not only the best school in the educational hub known as Kota Baru Parahyangan but also in the whole of Indonesia. If you need help converting your school in Indonesia to a school of international standard, visit my website (see above). You will see a copy of the testimonial from YPS of the work that I have done for them.

properties.name: Al-Istighfar Mosque
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoAl-Istighfar MosqueThis is the mosque where my children attend their Qur\'anic recitation classes. It is the centre of activities for the Muslim community in Pasir Ris.

properties.name: Aloha Loyang Resort Terrace 9
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto

properties.name: Amran's Mess
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto This is one of two houses that was used by me as my "mess" during my stint in Kota Baru Parahyangan as consultant to Al-Irsyad Satya Islamic School between March 2007 and May 2008.

properties.name: Apartment Block 29, Marine Crescent
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Apartment Block 29, Marine CrescentThis is where I lived for 17 years from 1975 to 1992. My son, Hazm, was the only one of my boys to have lived here. It is a "point block" rising to 25 floors. Lovely view of the Marine Parade Beach front and the port.

properties.name: Apt Blk 224, #04-138
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Apt Block 224, 04-138, Pasir Ris Street 21This is the first apartment that I bought. Moved into it when Hazm was almost a year old back in July (I think) 1992. Big hall for a a HDB apartment. My three boys loved playing in that "wide" open space.

properties.name: Arab Street
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoArab StreetA well-known street so-named because it was once an area with many Arab residents. Today, shophouses still lined the street where you can find textiles, perfumes, rattan goods and others.

properties.name: Baalwie Mosque, Singapore
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoBaalwie MosqueBuilt in 1952 by a prominent and well-respected imam from the Alatas family, this old generation masjid has served the needs of university undergraduates in Bukit Timah before the campus was relocated to Kent Ridge. Today, the one-storey masjid, which is located in the Central area, can accommodate up to 400 worshippers for daily and Friday prayers. It is also crowded during Hari Raya prayers. On Thursday evenings, many Muslims gather for recitation of ratib. To get here, see below: (TIBS): 171, 67, 700, 700, 77, 851, 852, 960, 961, 970, 980 Nearest MRT STATION: NEWTON (NS21)

properties.name: Block 40, Teban Gardens Road, Nyayi's old house
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Block 40, Teban Gardens Road, Nyayi\'s old houseThis was where Nyayi used to live before she moved to Yew Tee. This was also the house where I used to visit Siti before we got married. Our aqad nikah took place here with Ust Pasuni Maulan presiding as qadhi. I will always associate this place with Yayi Nasir. I remember him as a very nice man who does not have any pretensions. He was a well-respected member of the Muslim community in Teban. Hazm may not remember this but he took a tumble here down a flight of stairs when he was a toddler!

properties.name: Bugis MRT Station
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoBugis MRT StationThis is an underground MRT station. The station is linked to Bugis Junction, a shopping haven. this is the neareset station to the Sultan Mosque and the Arab Street area where you can find perhaps the most well-known places that sell murtabak. From here you can go to either the Sim Lim Tower or Sim Lim Square. The latter is a haven for electronics enthusiasts while the latter the place to check out for computer buffs.

properties.name: Buona Vista MRT Station
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoBuona Vista MRT Station

properties.name: Bus Stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Bus stop along Pasir Drive 3Alight here at this bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3 to go to Al-Istighfar Mosque and the Apex Harmony Lodge. This is also where you alight to go to the foot path where you can do macro photography and bird photography. Cross the road to go to the foot path. Take SBS Service 6 or 89 to get here.

properties.name: Bus stop along Nichol Drive
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoBus stop along Nichol DriveThis is the bus stop to alight at if you want to go to Changi Beach. SBS Service 89 plies this route.

properties.name: Bus stop along Nichol Drive
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Bus stop along Nichol DriveAlight here if you want to get to Changi Village. SBS Service 89 gets you here.

properties.name: Bus stop along Nichol Drive
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoBus stop along Nichol DriveYou take a bus towards Pasir Ris or Tampines from this bus stop. SBS Service 89 to Pasir Ris MRT.

properties.name: Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3Alight here at this bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3 to go to Al-Istighfar Mosque and the Apex Harmony Lodge. This is also where you alight to go to the foot path where you can do macro photography and bird photography. Take SBS Service 6 or 89 to get here.

properties.name: Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3, next to Block 239, Pasir Ris. Al-Istighfar Mosque and Apex Harmony Lodge are about 150 m south (5-minute walk). If you coming from the Pasir Ris MRT, it is the fourth bus-stop after the station or Pasir Ris Bus Interchange.

properties.name: Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3Bus stop along Pasir Ris Drive 3, next to Block 239, Pasir Ris. Al-Istighfar Mosque and Apex Harmony Lodge are about 150 m south (5-minute walk). Across the road is a foot bridge that leads to the Loyang Industrial Estate.

properties.name: Bus stop, nearest to Baalwie Mosque
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoBus Stop, nearest to Baalwie MosqueHow to get here: (TIBS): 171, 67, 700, 700, 77, 851, 852, 960, 961, 970, 980 Nearest MRT STATION: NEWTON (NS21)

properties.name: Bussorah Street
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Bussorah StreetNow a pedestrian mall, with old shophouses on either side. Geared very much for the tourists. During the fasting month (Ramadhan) the place becomes a bazaar selling cooked food and other goodies for working Muslims to take home for the breaking of the fast. My dada used to take me there when I was a kid.

properties.name: Car Park C, Pasir Ris
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto  Car Park C, Pasir RisCar park nearest to entrance to the board walk over the mangrove swamp at Pasir Ris Park.

properties.name: Changi Beach
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto   Changi BeachWell-known beach among Singaporeans. Have fond memories of the place. Site of many picnics with my family when I was a child. It has good changing facilities. The Changi Village Food Centre is nearby if you are hungry.

properties.name: Changi Village Food Centre
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Changi Village Food CentreA well-known makan (eating) place among locals. Very near Changi Beach. Supposedly contains the famous nasi lemak stalls of Singapore. Personally I like the Mamak drink stall especially the one one near the POSB ATM kiosk end of the centre. Love the teh halia (tea with milk garnished with ginger).

properties.name: Commonwealth MRT Station
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoCommonwealth MRT Station

properties.name: End of MRT Line at Pasir Ris
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoEnd of MRT line at Pasir RisMacro photography site

properties.name: Foot Bridge
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoFoot BridgeThis foot bridge links Pasir Ris Town to Loyang Industiral Estate.

properties.name: Foot path behind Al-Istighfar and Apex Harmony Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Path behind Al-Istighfar Mosque and Apex Harmony Lodge

properties.name: Hasanah Mosque, Teban Gardens Road
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Hasanah Mosque, Teban Gardens RoadThis is the Hasanah Mosque (Masjid Hasanah). The mosque was built as a result of very concerted efforts by the residents of the area to raise funds. They didn\'t want to wait for MUIS\' re-building programme so they took matters into their own hands. It was a result of these efforts that for several years, you would see their donation tin cans located all over Singapore at Muslim-owned shops. Alhamdulillah, they succeeded.

properties.name: Home of Naturefoto
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Apt Blk 239 Pasir Ris Street 21Home sweet home. This is where I lived. Apt Blk 239 Pasir Ris Street 21. This is a Housing and Development Board apartment block. My balcony overlooks the belukar and gives me a nice feeling whenever I look at it. I\'ve included a picture of the view from my balcony.

properties.name: Home, 14 Chapel Road
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Chapel RoadThis was my I first lived. A very quiet corner of Katong along a road so-named because of a Catholic Church at its entrance. The road leads to the old Marine Parade and the Katong Beach.

properties.name: Jacuzi
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto

properties.name: Kassim Mosque
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoKassim Mosque

properties.name: Katong Catholic Church
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoKatong Catholic ChurchThe church grounds used to be a playground for me. Centre for the Catholics living in the Katong and Siglap area. Used to be focal point of the Eurasian community as Katong was very much a Eurasian enclave then. The old building has been replaced by a spanking new one.

properties.name: Loyang Point
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoLoyang PointPopular hangout for grocery-hunting parents, and Greenview Secondary students.

properties.name: Marine Parade Road
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Marine Parade RoadThis road marks the old Katong beach shoreline. I remember the long conveyor belts bringing the earth from Siglap to reclaim the sea, approaching and destroying this beach. Filled me with much sadness. Soon the sea was gone and I remeber that my friends and I remember so wanted to see the sea again that we actually crossed the still soft and dangerous mud, passed the conveyor belts to see the "new sea". A big part of Katong died with that conveyor belt.

properties.name: Masjid Sultan or the Sultan Mosque
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoThis is the biggest mosque in Singapore located in the heart of Kampong Glam.

properties.name: Ministry of Education Building
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoMinistry of Education BuildingThis is the MOE Building. I worked there for more than three years with the Educational Technology Division (ETD). When ETD moved there, I think I had the best seat among all my colleagues. My office was on the fourteenth floor and I was seated right next to the window, overlooking the army camp next door and with a clear view of the Ayer Raja area. My most memorable experience was seeing a pair of hawks circling majestically just outside my window one day. I felt as if I could touch them. I remember also testing some GPS equipment around the building post-9/11. The security people came checking up on me. Hmmm.... I wonder what they think of it now that you can actually see the building through satelite maps like these?

properties.name: Murtabak Corner
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoMurtabak CornerHahahaha at this corner you will find two restaurants selling good murtabak. take the train to the Bugis MRT station if you want get here. Short walk from the station.

properties.name: Open area, Pasir Ris Park
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto  Open area, Pasir Ris ParkRelatively open area of Pasir Ris Park where one can usually spot Kingfishers on tree branches. Good for photography of these birds.

properties.name: Pasir Ris Mangrove Swamp
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto  Pasir Ris Mangrove SwampSwamp at Pasir Ris Park with a lovely board walk that meanders through some dense vegetation over a mangrove swamp. Board walk leads to a observation shed on bank of a river. Can watch birds like grey herons and kingfishers there. Also a good place for macro photography. Enter from Car Park C.

properties.name: Pasir Ris Primary School
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Pasir Ris Primary School"One of THE crappiest schools around. DO NOT send your child here." Sorry but these are my three boys\' view of their school :) Don\'t know why they feel that way. You must ask them ;) For a more balanced view (maybe), visit the website.

properties.name: Queenstown MRT station
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoQueenstown MRT Station

properties.name: Redhill MRT Station
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoRedhill MRT Station

properties.name: Rumah Nyayi
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoRumah Nyayi

properties.name: Rumah Wak Ogi
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoRumah Wak Ogi

properties.name: SPC Petrol Station at Pasir Ris street 21
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoSPC Petrol Kiosk at Pasir Ris Street 21When I first moved into Blk 224 which was just across the road, this site was an open field. I remember playing with Hazm a biplane glider which could glide around the field with just a throw. Lovely. The station was built everal years later and on its opening day, Singapore\'s favourite footballing son, Fandi Ahmad graced the occasion. The station was a mixed blessing. It saved me a long walk just to buy things like bread etc. On the other had the taxi drivers made it a nuisance as these chaps would congregate at the station as early as 4 am to clean their taxis before the change of shift. That\'s when they would start talking loudly to each other in the quiet of the early morning hours. The entrance and exit of the station was also a frequent site of accidents as in that short stretch of road in front of the station there were a few other entrances / exits to car parks. Cars would stop or drive out suddenly and it is not unusual to hear a screech and a bang when I lived in Blk 224.

properties.name: Sea Avenue, Katong
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoSea Avenue, KatongA little sleepy road that used to lead to the old Marine Parade or Katong beach front.

properties.name: Site of the old Joo Chiat Jetty
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoSite of Old Joo Chiat JettyA jetty used to stand here before the reclamation of the sea which led to the creation of the Marine Parade Hosuing Estate. Used to watch people fisihng from this jetty when I was a kid.

properties.name: St. Joseph's Institution
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto St. Joseph\'s InstitutionMy eldest son is in this school. It is one of the independent schools in Singapore. This is what my son has to say about the school: "SJI has taught me the important values of integrity and perseverance, and how to cultivate that in my life. SJI has shown me that academic development is not the only thing schools can do for a student." Phew....and I actually told him that it doesn\'t have to be something nice. For a more-balanced view of the school, visit its website :)

properties.name: St. Patrick's School
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto St. Patrick\'s SchoolHusayn\'s current school. Affiliated to St. Joseph\'s Institution which is Hazm\'s school. I\'ve sent my two boys to Catholic schools because I feel that they would treat my kids more like human beings rather than just mere digits in the school\'s examinations statistics. St. Pat\'s has a reputation for having "terrors" in the school. The present Principal has done a lot to clean up that image. It has a great military band and its soccer team has a well-known reputation too for producing well-known footballers for the local scene.

properties.name: Sultan Mosque
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoSultan MosqueThe biggest msoque in Singapore. Located in what used to be perhaps the heart of the Muslim community\'s intellectual activity. The area used to be a focal point of local Muslim scholar (ulama) and also those from the neighbouring region. It must be remembered that Singapore was an important port of call for the ships that used to carry the hajj pilgrims to and from Makkah, Arabia. Much of the arae still bears name which shows the Islamic heritage although unfortunately more of it has now become the part of the pub scene.

properties.name: Sungei Buloh Nature Reserve
properties.description: Posted by Kclama  My other photos in Singapore.

properties.name: The Bukit Timah Campus
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoThe Bukit Timah CampusThis was where the National Institute of Education was when I underwent my teacher-training back in 1987-88. It was also where I worked for about nine months in 2000 when I was posted to IT Training Branch of the Educational Technology Division (ETD). This was before the branch moved to the new MOE Building at North Buona Vista in September 2000. Visit the website for a history of the campus.

properties.name: The Maze at Pasir Ris Park
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto  Maze at Pasir Ris ParkMaze made from hedges.

properties.name: The Old Marine Parade
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto The Old Marine ParadeThis stretch of trees cover the old Marine Parade park. It was fronted by Katong Beach. This was my old footbal grounds when I was a kid. Lovely place then. Many used to fly simple kites from this spot overlooking a lallang field and an old war time machine gun bunker. During kite fighting season the sky will be dotted with waving kites engaged in aerial combat over the skies of Katong.

properties.name: Tower Block, Bukit Timah Campus
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoTower Block, Bukit Timah CampusMy office (IT Training Branch, ETD) was here on the sixth and seventh floor. Lovely campus with lovely old trees.

properties.name: Wak Jamal's House
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto Wak Jamal\'s House

properties.name: Wak La's House
properties.description: Posted by NaturefotoWak La\'s House

properties.name: War Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Jay

properties.name: Yang's Block
properties.description: Posted by Naturefoto  Yang\'s BlockYang is Siti\'s cousin. She lives on the ground floor of the block. A very funny and charming lady who puts people at ease. Great cook.
